intro: Oenanthe divaricata, commonly known as the variable water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, often wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Oenanthe divaricata is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator species for wetland ecosystems.
